item.title: Federal Reserve Board Governor Powell Responds to Trump's Firing Threat: No Intention to Resign, Will Not Yield to External Pressure
item.description: August 22: Federal Reserve Board Governor Powell responded to Trump's threat of dismissal by stating that he has "no intention of resigning in the face of threats" and emphasizing that he will not be swayed by external pressure.Earlier today, Trump declared that if Federal Reserve Board Governor Powell does not resign, he will remove her. (Straits Financial News)

item.title: Cryptocurrency Total Market Cap Reclaims Above $4 Trillion, With a Nearly 3.8% Increase in the Last 24 Hours
item.description: On August 22nd, based on CoinGecko data, the total cryptocurrency market capitalization has rebounded and is now above $4 trillion, standing at $4.066 trillion with a 24-hour percentage change of 3.8%. Additionally, the current Bitcoin dominance is 57%, and the Ethereum dominance is 13.8%.

item.title: 「Fed's Signal Booster」: Powell Opens Door to Rate Cut as Early as Next Month
item.description: On August 22nd, Nick Timiraos, a renowned journalist from The Wall Street Journal and often referred to as the "Fed Whisperer", reported that Federal Reserve Chairman Powell opened the door on Friday to the potential of a rate cut at the next month's meeting. He cited a more significant slowdown in the labor market, which could counterbalance concerns about tariffs driving up costs and fueling inflation.However, Powell's remarks, by highlighting concerns about inflation, have moderated the market's anticipation of aggressive consecutive rate cuts by the Federal Reserve. Inflation has been staying above the Fed's 2% target for more than four years.

item.title: Source: Canada to Maintain Tariffs on U.S. Automobiles, Steel, and Aluminum
item.description: August 22nd. Source: The tariffs imposed by Canada on U.S. automobiles, steel, and aluminum will continue to remain unchanged. (Xinhua)

item.title: 「Big Brother Buddy」 Huang Licheng has now realized a gain of $1.52 million, while PUMP and YZY are still in an unrealized loss position.
item.description: On August 22nd, according to on-chain analyst Ai Yi (@ai_9684xtpa), this morning, "Brother Ma Ge" Huang Licheng's five long positions still had a high floating loss of up to $9.17 million. However, now they have a total floating profit of $1.52 million. Among them, the ETH long position has a floating profit of $1.645 million, and currently only PUMP and YZY are still in a floating loss.

item.title: The Federal Reserve's September interest rate meeting is scheduled for September 18, with the probability of a rate cut rising to 91.2%.
item.description: August 22nd. Based on CME's "FedWatch" data, following Powell's speech, the likelihood of a Fed rate cut in September has risen to 91.2%.As planned, the Fed's September interest rate meeting will take place at 2:00 AM Beijing time on September 18th. There are currently 26 days and 3 hours remaining until the meeting.

item.title: In the past hour, the total amount of liquidated positions across the whole network has expanded to $236 million, with the primary position being a short.
item.description: On August 22nd, according to Coinglass data, the network-wide liquidation within nearly 1 hour expanded to $236 million, and the short liquidations totaled $195 million.

item.title: Bitcoin briefly surpassed $116,000, with a nearly 3.15% price increase in the past hour.
item.description: On August 22nd, according to HTX market data, Bitcoin briefly exceeded $116,000 and is currently trading at $116,008, with a 1-hour price increase of 3.15%.

item.title: Bitcoin OG Whale's Long ETH Position Unrealized Gain Tops $40 Million
item.description: On August 22nd, based on LookOnChain's monitoring, with the ETH price breaking through $4600, the unrealized gains of a Bitcoin OG whale from taking a long position in ETH have exceeded $40 million. It is reported that the whale holds a position of up to 135,265 ETH, which is valued at $5.77 billion.

item.title: Analysis: Powell's Speech Suggests High Likelihood of Continuous Rate Cuts Starting in September
item.description: On August 22nd, Market strategist Art Hogan stated that Powell's capability to discuss the shifting balance of risks indicates that policy might need to make corresponding adjustments. This serves as a clear indication that he is inclined to support future rate cuts and may take action in September, October, and December. In other words, the impetus clearly stems from the softness of the labor market rather than the core commodity price increases resulting from tariffs... The distinct message conveyed to the market is: A September rate cut is now highly likely. (Xinhua Finance)
